ai.summary: A gentle 1.4 km circuit suitable for butterfly enthusiasts and casual walkers. The easy route follows grassy paths and compact gravel, with seasonal wildflowers that attract butterflies along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat overall. The trail uses grassy tracks, compact gravel, and a short boardwalk. Expect some uneven or muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and appropriate clothing. Stay on designated paths to protect wildlife and reduce tick exposure. Be mindful of weather changes in the UK and bring water, especially in summer. If walking alone, inform someone of your plans.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn (roughly March to September) when wildflowers bloom and butterfly activity is highest; summer offers longer daylight and better visibility.

seo.meta_description: Explore a gentle 1.4 km butterfly walk in the UK. Easy terrain, seasonal wildflowers, and tips on gear and safety for a family-friendly outing.
